verses.text: Furthermore David the king said unto all the congregation , Solomon my son , whom alone God hath chosen , \add is yet\add* young and tender , and the work \add is\add* great : for the palace \add is\add* not for man , but for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God.

Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for \add things to be made\add* of gold , and the silver for \add things\add* of silver , and the brass for \add things\add* of brass , the iron for \add things\add* of iron , and wood for \add things\add* of wood ; onyx stones , and \add stones\add* to be set , glistering stones , and of divers colours , and all manner of precious stones , and marble stones in abundance.

Moreover, because I have set my affection to the house of my God , I have of mine own proper good , of gold and silver , \add which\add* I have given to the house of my God , over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house ,
\add Even\add* three thousand talents of gold , of the gold of Ophir , and seven thousand talents of refined silver , to overlay the walls of the houses \add withal:\add*

The gold for \add things\add* of gold , and the silver for \add things\add* of silver , and for all manner of work \add to be made\add* by the hands of artificers. And who \add then\add* is willing to consecrate his service this day unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*?\f + \fr 29.5 \ft consecrate his service: Heb. fill his hand\f* \p
¶ Then the chief of the fathers and princes of the tribes of Israel , and the captains of thousands and of hundreds , with the rulers of the king’s work , offered willingly ,

And gave for the service of the house of God of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand drams , and of silver ten thousand talents , and of brass eighteen thousand talents , and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
And they with whom \add precious\add* stones were found gave \add them\add* to the treasure of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, by the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.

Then the people rejoiced , for that they offered willingly , because with perfect heart they offered willingly to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and David the king also rejoiced with great joy. \p

¶ Wherefore David blessed the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* before all the congregation : and David said , Blessed \add be\add* thou, 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Israel our father , for ever and ever.

Thine, O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, \add is\add* the greatness , and the power , and the glory , and the victory , and the majesty : for all \add that is\add* in the heaven and in the earth \add is thine;\add* thine \add is\add* the kingdom , O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and thou art exalted as head above all.

Both riches and honour \add come\add* of thee , and thou reignest over all; and in thine hand \add is\add* power and might ; and in thine hand \add it is\add* to make great , and to give strength unto all.
Now therefore, our God , we thank thee, and praise thy glorious name.

But who \add am\add* I, and what \add is\add* my people , that we should be able to offer so willingly after this sort? for all things \add come\add* of thee, and of thine own have we given thee.\f + \fr 29.14 \ft be able: Heb. retain, or, obtain strength\f*\f + \fr 29.14 \ft of thine…: Heb. of thine hand\f*

For we \add are\add* strangers before thee, and sojourners , as \add were\add* all our fathers : our days on the earth \add are\add* as a shadow , and \add there is\add* none abiding.\f + \fr 29.15 \ft abiding: Heb. expectation\f*
O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God , all this store that we have prepared to build thee an house for thine holy name \add cometh\add* of thine hand , and \add is\add* all thine own.

I know also, my God , that thou triest the heart , and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of mine heart I have willingly offered all these things: and now have I seen with joy thy people , which are present here, to offer willingly unto thee.\f + \fr 29.17 \ft present: Heb. found\f*

O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Abraham , Isaac , and of Israel , our fathers , keep this for ever in the imagination of the thoughts of the heart of thy people , and prepare their heart unto thee:\f + \fr 29.18 \ft prepare: or, stablish\f*

And give unto Solomon my son a perfect heart , to keep thy commandments , thy testimonies , and thy statutes , and to do all \add these things\add*, and to build the palace , \add for\add* the which I have made provision. \p

¶ And David said to all the congregation , Now bless the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* your God. And all the congregation blessed the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of their fathers , and bowed down their heads , and worshipped the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and the king.

And they sacrificed sacrifices unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and offered burnt offerings unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, on the morrow after that day , \add even\add* a thousand bullocks , a thousand rams , \add and\add* a thousand lambs , with their drink offerings , and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel :

And did eat and drink before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* on that day with great gladness. And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time , and anointed \add him\add* unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add to be\add* the chief governor , and Zadok \add to be\add* priest. \p
Then Solomon sat on the throne of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* as king instead of David his father , and prospered ; and all Israel obeyed him.
And all the princes , and the mighty men , and all the sons likewise of king David , submitted themselves unto Solomon the king.\f + \fr 29.24 \ft submitted…: Heb. gave the hand under Solomon\f*

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel , and bestowed upon him \add such\add* royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel. \p
¶ Thus David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
And the time that he reigned over Israel \add was\add* forty years ; seven years reigned he in Hebron , and thirty and three \add years\add* reigned he in Jerusalem.
And he died in a good old age , full of days , riches , and honour : and Solomon his son reigned in his stead.

Now the acts of David the king , first and last , behold, they \add are\add* written in the book of Samuel the seer , and in the book of Nathan the prophet , and in the book of Gad the seer ,\f + \fr 29.29 \ft book: or, history: Heb. words\f*
With all his reign and his might , and the times that went over him, and over Israel , and over all the kingdoms of the countries.
